When IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m above 200 km and below 1 Mm, I cannot start the time warp. The message is not Ã¢â‚¬ËœYou cannot warp faster than 1Ãƒâ€” below 1000 kmÃ¢â‚¬â„¢, but Ã¢â‚¬ËœYou cannot warp when the vessel is under accelerationÃ¢â‚¬â„¢.

As far as I understand, JoolÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s atmosphere starts at 200 km over the surface. When IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m between 200 and 1000, the ship doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t actually experience any acceleration, its orbit is stable. When the time warp starts above 1000 km, it doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t stop at 1000 and works OK until I stop and want to warp again.

What causes this strange behavior?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-03T02:12:54Z" title="06/03/2015 02:12  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 3, 2015</time> by Teilnehmer**
I had the same problem yesterday, I keep getting the "You cannot warp when the vessel is under acceleration" message. Still haven't figured it out.
There was a thread about this last week, and many people, including myself, have encountered this. Not sure what causes it, unfortunately.
Strangely, I saw the same thing with my Jool satellite, and after a few orbits it actually disappeared. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I literally saw jool bending my trajectory while doing a pass. Normally you would expect a smooth curve but this wasn't like that. My trajectory literally looked like it was getting pulled towards jool at the closest point then going back up again ![-_-](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_sleep.png). At that moment it said that i was accelerating too.
FWIW there is a bugtracker issue on this already.

> 
> FWIW there is a bugtracker issue on this already.

[Indeed](http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/4915).
